title: 111_s1603
content: The Act titled "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or "VETS Act of 2009" provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service. The "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service, amending Section 484B(b)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to ensure institutions refund tuition when a student withdraws due to military service. The "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" requires institutions to refund tuition and fees to students who withdraw from higher education due to military service. The "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" mandates institutions to refund tuition and fees to students who withdraw from higher education due to military service, excluding payments made from scholarships. The "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" requires institutions to refund tuition and fees to students who withdraw from higher education due to military service, except for payments from scholarships or funds awarded under this title. Repayment waivers are allowed for students. The "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" mandates institutions to refund tuition and fees to students withdrawing due to military service, excluding scholarships or funds awarded under this title. Repayment waivers are permitted for students called to military service. The Secretary can waive amounts students need to return if withdrawals are due to military service, and loan forgiveness is authorized for withdrawals from higher education institutions. Loan forgiveness is authorized for student withdrawals from higher education institutions due to service in the uniformed services. The Secretary can carry out a program to repay the outstanding loan principle and accrued interest for students who did not receive academic credit due to withdrawal for uniformed services. The program allows the holder of the loan to assume the obligation to repay the outstanding principle and accrued interest on any loan assistance awarded to the student under part B. The program allows the holder of the loan to assume the obligation to repay any loan assistance awarded to the student under part B, minus any amount returned by the institution. The program allows the holder of the loan to assume the obligation to repay any loan assistance awarded to the student under part B, minus any amount returned by the institution for such payment period or period of enrollment. The program allows the holder of the loan to cancel the outstanding principle and accrued interest on the loan assistance awarded to the student under part D or E. The program allows cancellation of outstanding loan principle and accrued interest for student loan assistance under part D or E. The program allows cancellation of outstanding loan principle and accrued interest for student loan assistance under part D or E, minus any amount returned by the institution for such payment period or period of enrollment. The Secretary will reimburse institutions for cancelled Perkins loans equal to the aggregate amount in the institution's student loan fund. The Secretary will reimburse institutions for cancelled Perkins loans equal to the aggregate amount in the institution's student loan fund, minus loans made from Federal capital contributions. The Secretary will reimburse institutions for cancelled Perkins loans equal to the aggregate amount in the institution's student loan fund, minus loans made from Federal capital contributions under section 468. None of the funds appropriated pursuant to section 461(b) shall be available for payments. The Secretary will pay qualifying institutions under section 468 within 3 months of filing an application for campus-based funds. Loan eligibility and limits for students include the return of any unused amounts. The institution must qualify within 3 months of filing an application for campus-based funds. Loan eligibility and limits for students involve returning unused amounts. The institution's forgiveness or waiver of loan amounts due to military service withdrawal does not count towards a student's loan limits. The forgiveness or waiver of loan amounts due to military service withdrawal does not affect a student's loan limits or eligibility for grants or loans under this title. The term 'service in the uniformed services' is defined in section 484C(a). The amendments made by this Act regarding service in the uniformed services will take effect after the date of enactment. The term "period of service in the uniformed services" is defined as the period beginning after the date of enactment. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for periods of service in the uniformed services starting after the date of enactment. The term "period of service in the uniformed services" refers to the time from 30 days before a student is required to report for service until they return.
